name: akeyless-server-commons
description: Shared Node.js/TypeScript utility library for Akeyless server-side applications — including Firebase integration, Redis caching, Express middlewares, email/SMS/push notifications, authentication helpers, logging, translation, and shared type definitions.
story: akeyless-server-commons is the foundational shared library used across all Akeyless backend services. It centralises the recurring concerns every Express/Node.js service must handle: bootstrapping a Firebase Admin app, reading and writing Firestore documents, managing a Redis cache layer with snapshot support, sending transactional emails and push notifications, validating and normalising phone numbers, resolving geographic distances, running authenticated login flows, and enforcing request-level middleware (auth verification, body trimming, structured error responses). By extracting these cross-cutting concerns into a single versioned package, individual microservices stay thin and consistent — they import from one well-tested location rather than duplicating infrastructure logic.
capabilities: Firebase Admin SDK integration (Firestore CRUD, Auth, Storage, snapshots)
Redis cache management with key utilities and snapshot helpers
Express middleware (auth verification, body trimming, error handling, request logging)
Task execution and data persistence utilities
Shared TypeScript types, interfaces, and enums
